questions.question: What is a common consequence of OS command injection?

explanations.a: Incorrect. OS command injection does not improve performance.
explanations.b: Correct! OS command injection can lead to unauthorized data access.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The focus is on unauthorized command execution, not speed.
explanations.d: Incorrect. OS command injection is unrelated to system updates.

questions.question: Which character is often used to chain commands in OS command injection?

explanations.a: Correct! The '&' character is commonly used to chain commands.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The '%' character is not used for chaining commands.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The '#' character is used for comments, not chaining commands.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The '$' character is used for variable expansion, not chaining commands.

questions.question: How can input validation help prevent OS command injection?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Allowing all characters can lead to vulnerabilities.
explanations.b: Correct! Blocking special characters can help prevent command injection.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Input validation is not related to command execution speed.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Input validation focuses on security, not user experience.

questions.question: What is the primary reason OS command injection is dangerous?

answers.b: It can give attackers full system control

explanations.a: Incorrect. Speed is not the main concern.
explanations.b: Correct! Attackers can gain full system control via command injection.
explanations.c: Incorrect. It does not reduce storage.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It is unrelated to system updates.

questions.question: Which tool is commonly used to detect OS command injection vulnerabilities?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Wireshark is mainly used for network traffic analysis.
explanations.b: Incorrect. sqlmap is focused on SQL injection, not OS command injection.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Nikto scans web servers but not specifically for OS command injection.
explanations.d: Correct! Burp Suite can detect OS command injection vulnerabilities during security testing.

questions.question: In modern secure development, what is the best strategy to handle system commands safely?

answers.a: Use direct string concatenation with user input
answers.b: Restrict execution to pre-defined safe commands
answers.c: Run commands with maximum system privileges

explanations.a: Incorrect. String concatenation with user input is unsafe.
explanations.b: Correct! Whitelisting safe commands reduces OS command injection risk.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Running with maximum privileges increases the impact of exploits.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Logging is unrelated to command injection prevention.

reviewNote: Some of the questions in this section do not have a reference in the theory provided.
